info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 4:58PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RAIN/SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A rain/snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. Rain could change to snow fairly rapidly, even in low elevations, under the heaviest precipitation. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 455 PM MDT, a rain/snow squall was along a line extending from near Fruita to 21 miles west of Grand Junction to 18 miles east of Castle Valley and moving northeast at 15 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... West Grand Junction, Fruita, Loma, Gateway, Mack, Glade Park, and Redlands. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 2 and 29. Utah 128 between mile markers 23 and 25, and between mile markers 28 and 33. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 13. Colorado 141 between mile markers 107 and 123. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
